column4: Apple asks court to make Samsung pay $180 million more in patent dispute
column5: NEW YORK Just over a week after Samsung paid Apple more than $548 million for infringing the patents and designs of the iPhone  Apple has asked a U.S. court to force its biggest smartphone rival to cough up even more.

column4: UPDATE 2-Alibaba agrees to invest $1.25 bln in Chinese online food delivery service - report
column5: SHANGHAI  Dec 25 Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  has agreed to invest $1.25 billion in Chinese online food delivery service Ele.me  leading business weekly Caixin reported on Friday.

column4: RPT-INSIGHT-In an M&A boom year  deals-driven hedge funds are burned by bad bets
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 24 This year  betting on corporate takeovers and restructurings should have been a sure thing for investors as the value of deals soared to record levels. It didn't work out that way.

column4: Hyatt Hotels attacked with payment-card stealing malware
column5: Hyatt Hotels Corp said on Wednesday that its payment processing system was infected with credit-card-stealing malware in an attack discovered three weeks ago  the latest in a series of breaches at hospitality firms. |Â Video

column4: Taiwan stocks edge up ahead of holidays
column5: TAIPEI  Dec 25 Taiwan stocks edged up on Friday amid pre-Christmas caution  with heavyweights such as Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) little changed.

column4: Toyota tops global car sales in November  outsells VW for fifth month
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp  sold more cars than Volkswagen AG  for the fifth consecutive month in November  putting the Japanese firm on track to remain the world's top-selling automaker in 2015 as sales at the German maker suffer following a diesel emissions scandal.

column4: Toyota tops global car sales in Nov  outsells VW for 5th month
column5: TOKYO  Dec 25 Toyota Motor Corp sold more cars than Volkswagen AG for the fifth consecutive month in November  putting the Japanese firm on track to remain the world's top-selling automaker in 2015 as sales at the German maker suffer following a diesel emissions scandal.

column4: Valeant says CEO J. Michael Pearson hospitalized with severe pneumonia
column5: NEW YORK Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  Chief Executive J. Michael Pearson was hospitalized with a "severe case of pneumonia" on Friday and is receiving treatment  a company spokeswoman said.
